comments:
This course is the second part of an introductory sequence on basic algorithms and data structures in the Java programming language. The class culminates in a final large project that introduces some of the challenges of software development.

Some students were satisfied with the content covered by the course, while others were disappointed in the organization.

Students thought Professor Daniilidis was an extremely nice person, giving frequent extensions for homework assignment. However, they did mention that these assignments were not very clear and were reflected in Professor Daniilidis’ erratic teaching style.

This course is targeted towards students interested in deepening their knowledge of programming from a prerequisite, CIS 120. Another prerequisite is CIS 160.
